definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Their job is to make or confirm reservations.
sentences.chinese: 他们的工作就是为旅客定票。

sentences.english: Besides, group ticket booking will considerably facilitate college students.
sentences.chinese: 此外，集体定票方便大学生。

sentences.english: Can we book the tickets ahead?
I should have called to make an airline reservation, but I didn't.
sentences.chinese: 我本应该给航空公司打电话定票的，但我没有。

sentences.english: You can reserve the tickets by phone.
Many people call the reservations office for booking flights.
sentences.chinese: 许多人称定票处为预约航班。

sentences.english: The clerks at the reservations desk are called reservations agents.
sentences.chinese: 在定票点上班的职员我们称为飞机票代理商。

definition: to bounce (a check)/to return a ticket/ticket refund
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
